item.title: Trump says he will try to get back territory for Ukraine in talks with Putin
item.description: The US president says talks with Putin on Friday will be a "feel-out meeting" aimed at urging Russia to end the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Zelensky could still attend Trump-Putin meeting, but rest of Europe is shut out
item.description: As things stand, there are no invites for the country being invaded, nor the continent it sits in, writes James Waterhouse.

item.title: Trump deploys National Guard to Washington DC and pledges crime crackdown
item.description: The president also takes control of the city's police force, as the mayor rejects his claims of a crime wave.

item.title: UN condemns targeted Israeli attack that killed five Al Jazeera journalists
item.description: Israel says it targeted correspondent Anas al-Sharif, accusing him of leading a Hamas cell, which he had denied. Israel provided little evidence for t...

item.title: Chip giants Nvidia and AMD to pay 15% of sales revenue in China to US
item.description: The chip giants will hand revenues to the US government in exchange for licences to export to China.
